main_definition: Fully complete, ideal, or without any flaws or defects.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reaching the highest level of excellence; nothing better can be done or achieved.
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of practice, she played the piano perfectly.
The stain-free shirt was a perfect match for his suit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Absolutely right or suitable; completely agreeable.
meanings_and_examples.example: I think it's perfect weather for a picnic today.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exactly what is needed or wanted, without any deficiencies.
meanings_and_examples.example: The new software update was the perfect solution to our problem.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having no mistakes; accurate and precise.
meanings_and_examples.example: He takes great pride in his perfectly written essays.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exhibiting a state of spiritual or emotional fulfillment.
meanings_and_examples.example: After meditation, she felt a sense of perfect peace within herself.
